EmailTemplate.subject: RE: Possible arrangement (1360186498.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
- - - Clean Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE Hi Steven, Good to hear from you! I would love to get with you via phone and discuss this set up and see if it makes sense to run this through MBO. Please schedule a time to speak with me at your convenience by clicking here <https://my.timedriver.com/8SLYS>. Looking forward to connecting,Sara___________________________________ SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>w: www.mbopartners.com <http://www.mbopartners.com/> We’ve got some serious perks you’re eligible to win when you refer a friend <http://referral.mbopartners.com/referral-program?r=conde> to MBO Partners! Ask me about them. Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com <mailto:postmaster@mbopartners.com> and permanently delete the e-mail and files. From: Steven Alexander [mailto:steven.j.alexander@usa.net] Sent: Tuesday, February 05, 2013 5:55 PM To: info Subject: Possible arrangement Hi,
I was an independent consultant working through MyBizOffice from 1999 - 2002. (Was that you?) My circumstances have changed a lot since then, but I would like to explore a possible arrangement with you.
I own a new, small business and the only workers I have so far are my wife and me. My COBRA medical insurance ends in four months. Personal medical insurance is not as good as group medical insurance. Could you hire my wife and contract with my company for her compensation in order to let her have your group medical insurance for our family?
Thanks,
Steven Alexander Pee Wee Bees, LLC
